intro: Duvalia transvaalensis var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered duvalia, is a perennial shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
